author: Syed Sajjad Ali
text:
CPI(M) MLA Manoranjan Acharjee, who resigned after his expulsion from the party last month, was arrested on Saturday for allegedly molesting a minor girl. The police produced Mr. Acharjee in a court, which remanded him in custody for three days.

The arrest comes a month after the CPI(M) leader was stripped of his primary membership and all party positions for allegedly molesting the girl in Amarpur in south Tripura on November 27. Mr. Acharjee subsequently sent his resignation letter to the Assembly Speaker.

On Friday, the main Opposition Congress raised the issue at the opening session of the Assembly, demanding the arrest of Mr. Acharjee. Order was restored in the House after Chief Minister Manik Sarkar assured the members of action as per law.

‘Political conspiracy’

Mr. Acharjee has denied all charges, claiming that it was part of “a well-hatched political conspiracy” against him.
title: Expelled CPI(M) MLA held for molestation
